snippet: The Delhi region’s Transport Department banned the hail-a-ride service after one of its drivers appeared in court on suspicion of raping a passenger.
abstract: Uber ride service is banned in region around New Delhi after Shiv Kumar Yadav, one of service's drivers, appears in court on suspicion of raping passenger; criticism of Uber's licensing and screening procedures are heightened when it emerges that Yadav had been detained previously on suspicion of raping another female passenger.

byline.original: By ELLEN BARRY and SUHASINI RAJ
byline.contributor: Nida Najar contributed reporting from New Delhi, and Mark Scott from London.

lead_paragraph: The Delhi region’s Transport Department banned the hail-a-ride service after one of its drivers appeared in court on suspicion of raping a passenger.

headline.main: Uber Banned in India’s Capital After Rape Accusation
